activity.title: ohcnetwork/metabase_manager#16
activity.text: A solution that I have been able to find is to move the api folder within app completely to a new directory called pages and keep the rest of the files within the app folder but I'm not sure of whether such a change is recommended. The API does show as working in the test file when this change is made. To implement our own custom authorisation however, we do need to install nodeemailer and have a user email and password saved in the env file. I would like some guidance on the same

activity.title: ohcnetwork/metabase_manager#16
activity.text: Attempting local auth but facing errors

activity.title: ohcnetwork/metabase_manager#14
activity.text:
I would like to receive feedback about how the embedded dashboards should look in metabase manager app. 
![WhatsApp Image 2024-04-02 at 20 11 54 (1)](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/metabase_manager/assets/48214113/7e84144c-c90c-499f-9ac7-7135d6c7c754)
![WhatsApp Image 2024-04-02 at 20 11 54](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/metabase_manager/assets/48214113/f78631cd-5346-487a-8c42-1a9b350b72e9)
We have the navigation bar set up where we can click on the state link which leads to another page on the app that showcases the embedded dashboard but there are no distinctive signifiers that show that it is on the metabase manager app. Would we like to incorporate such features so it doesn't feel like it has led to a separate app.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/metabase_manager#13
activity.text: @Ashesh3 @gigincg I've added the functionalities as requested. Please have a look and let me know if they're good and I will start implementing the design improvements!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/metabase_manager#12
activity.text:
